what: An R package for land use planning and management of multiple environmental services
title: An R package for land use planning and management of multiple environmental services
text: experiment package core functions LUMENS R package. packaging functions, LUMENS developers benefit improved code organization, version control, testing capabilities. proposed exercise primarily rely devtools. LUMENSR tool experimental development, currently offering Pre-QuES module. module facilitates analysis land use changes comparing land cover maps two distinct time periods. comparison provides valuable insights land use specific region transformed time. get started see: - Pre-QuES Report example: example LUMENSR report Pre-QuES module, process land use land cover data meaningful information land cover change patterns composition. - Function reference: overview LUMENSR functions

title: An R package for land use planning and management of multiple environmental services
text: LUMENSR currently experimental development, install latest development version GitHub using following commands: installation, load package : installed, can use package R console, within quarto documents within Shiny applications. may need download quarto CLI.

title: An R package for land use planning and management of multiple environmental services
text: appreciate feedback contributions. Please report problems encountered using LUMENSR “issues” GitHub repository. input help us improve package!

title: An R package for land use planning and management of multiple environmental services
text: ’s simple example use LUMENSR:
code: # Load the LUMENSR package library(LUMENSR)  # Load the example raster files for 1990 and 2020 and convert them into a terra::rast object lc_t1 <- terra::rast(LUMENSR_example("NTT_LC90.tif")) t1 <- 1990 lc_t2 <- terra::rast(LUMENSR_example("NTT_LC20.tif")) t2 <- 2020  # Add a legend to the raster files using a lookup table lc_t1_attr <- add_legend_to_categorical_raster(raster_file = lc_t1,                                                lookup_table = lc_lookup_klhk_sequence,                                                year = t1) lc_t2_attr <- add_legend_to_categorical_raster(raster_file = lc_t2,                                                lookup_table = lc_lookup_klhk_sequence,                                                year = t2)  # Create a frequency table (crosstab) from the list of raster files crosstab_result <- create_crosstab(c(lc_t1_attr, lc_t2_attr))  # Abbreviate the column names in the frequency table crosstab_result_abbreviated <-   abbreviate_by_column(     df = crosstab_result$crosstab_long,     col_names = as.character(c(t1, t2)),     remove_vowels = FALSE   )  # Create a Sankey diagram from the abbreviated frequency table # Set area_cutoff to 10000 to exclude small land cover changes # Set change_only to FALSE to include all land cover categories create_sankey(crosstab_result_abbreviated,               area_cutoff = 10000,                change_only = FALSE)

what: Replace Column Values with Shorter Version — abbreviate_by_column
title: Replace Column Values with Shorter Version — abbreviate_by_column
text: function shortens character column values data frame removing vowels first character, also provides option disable vowel removal. replaces spaces underscores removes characters slash. column names provided, function attempts find use first character column data frame.

title: Replace Column Values with Shorter Version — abbreviate_by_column
Replace Column Values with Shorter Version — abbreviate_by_column
text: df data frame. col_names character vector specifying names columns abbreviated. NULL (default), function attempts use first character column. remove_vowels logical value indicating whether remove vowels column values first character. Default FALSE.

title: Replace Column Values with Shorter Version — abbreviate_by_column
text: data frame specified columns abbreviated.

title: Replace Column Values with Shorter Version — abbreviate_by_column
code: df <- data.frame(   col1 = c("Hutan lahan kering sekunder / bekas tebangan", "Savanna / Padang rumput"),   col2 = c("Hutan lahan kering sekunder", "Savanna"),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) abbreviate_by_column(df, c("col1", "col2"), remove_vowels=TRUE) #>                 col1               col2 #> 1 Htn_lhn_krng_skndr Htn_lhn_krng_skndr #> 2               Svnn               Svnn

what: Abbreviate a column of a lookup table — abbreviate_lookup
title: Abbreviate a column of a lookup table — abbreviate_lookup
text: function takes data frame (df) name column (col_name) input, returns modified version data frame additional abbr column containing abbreviated versions text specified column. abbreviation done removing vowels words, except vowel first character word. column name specified, function use first character column data frame. input data frame least one column, specified column exist character column, function stop return error message.

title: Abbreviate a column of a lookup table — abbreviate_lookup
Abbreviate a column of a lookup table — abbreviate_lookup
text: df data frame used lookup table. Must least one column. col_name name column abbreviate. NULL, first character column used.

text: tibble additional abbr column containing abbreviated versions text specified column.

title: Assign a time period to a SpatRaster object — assign_time_period
code: # Load terra package library(terra) #> terra 1.7.71 # Create example SpatRaster r <- rast(nrow=10, ncol=10) r[] <- 1:ncell(r) # Assign a time period assign_time_period(r, "2023") #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 10, 10, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 36, 18  (x, y) #> extent      : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84  #> source(s)   : memory #> name        : lyr.1  #> min value   :     1  #> max value   :   100  #> time (years): 2023

what: Calculate land cover frequency for multiple raster layers — calc_lc_freq
title: Calculate land cover frequency for multiple raster layers — calc_lc_freq
text: function takes multiple raster layers input returns frequency table layer, sorted count last raster layer descending order. input terra's rast object allowed.

title: Calculate land cover frequency for multiple raster layers — calc_lc_freq
Calculate land cover frequency for multiple raster layers — calc_lc_freq
text: raster_list list raster layers single raster layer.

title: Calculate land cover frequency for multiple raster layers — calc_lc_freq
text: dataframe frequency tables.

title: Calculate land cover frequency for multiple raster layers — calc_lc_freq
code: if (FALSE) { library(tidyverse)  # Create a vector of raster file names lc_maps <- c("kalbar_LC11.tif", "kalbar_LC20.tif") %>%   # Apply LUMENSR_example function to each file in the vector   map(~ LUMENSR_example(.x)) %>%   # Convert each file to a raster object   map(~ terra::rast(.x)) %>%   # Add a legend to each raster object using a provided lookup table   map(~ add_legend_to_categorical_raster(raster_file = .x, lookup_table = lc_lookup_klhk))  # Calculate the frequency table for each raster object in the list freq_table <- calc_lc_freq(lc_maps)  # Print the resulting frequency table print(freq_table) }

title: Calculate Trajectory Map — calc_trajectory_map
code: calc_trajectory_map(   lc_t1_,   lc_t2_,   lookup_traj_reclass,   lookup_trajectory_complete,   trajectory_column_name = "trajectory" )

title: Calculate Trajectory Map — calc_trajectory_map
text: lc_t1_ raster object representing land cover time 1. lc_t2_ raster object representing land cover time 2. lookup_traj_reclass data frame containing reclassification rules. lookup_trajectory_complete data frame containing lookup table trajectories. trajectory_column_name string representing column name trajectory lookup table.

title: Calculate Trajectory Map — calc_trajectory_map
text: raster object representing trajectory map.

title: Calculate Trajectory Map — calc_trajectory_map
code: if (FALSE) { # assuming we have two raster objects "lc_t1", "lc_t2", #a reclassification table "lookup_traj_reclass", # and a lookup table "lookup_trajectory_complete" my_trajectory_map <- calc_trajectory_map(lc_t1_, lc_t2_, lookup_traj_reclass, lookup_trajectory_complete, trajectory_column_name = "trajectory") }

title: Create Crosstab From Raster List — create_crosstab
Create Crosstab From Raster List — create_crosstab
text: land_cover list 'SpatRaster' objects. zone SpatRaster' object planning unit/zone

title: Create Crosstab From Raster List — create_crosstab
text: data frame representing crosstab input rasters.

title: Create Crosstab From Raster List — create_crosstab
code: if (FALSE) {   # Read in the legend for raster data   subset_legend <- LUMENSR::lc_lookup_klhk    # Read raster files   raster_files <- c("kalbar_LC11.tif", "kalbar_LC15.tif", "kalbar_LC20.tif") %>%     map(LUMENSR_example) %>%     map(rast)    # Loop through raster files   land_cover <- map(raster_files,                             ~apply_lookup_table(raster_file = .x,                                                 lookup_lc = subset_legend))    # Turn raster files into a frequency table   crosstab_result <- create_crosstab(land_cover) }

Create a Sankey Diagram — create_sankey

title: Create a Sankey Diagram — create_sankey
Create a Sankey Diagram — create_sankey
text: freq_table frequency table containing land cover T1, T2, T3, etc.. Frequency column (numeric). column named "Ha" exists, used instead "Freq". area_cutoff Minimum number pixels land use land cover frequency include. change_only Logical flag, TRUE exclude persistent land cover.

title: Create a Sankey Diagram — create_sankey
text: Sankey plot.

title: Create a Sankey Diagram — create_sankey
text: Dony Indiarto

title: Create a Sankey Diagram — create_sankey
code: if (FALSE) {   synthetic_data <- data.frame(     "1990" = rep(c("Forest", "Urban", "Agriculture", "Water"), each = 4),     "2020" = rep(c("Forest", "Urban", "Agriculture", "Water"), 4),     Freq = sample(1:100, 16)   ) %>%     dplyr::arrange("1990")    create_sankey(freq_table = synthetic_data, area_cutoff = 0, change_only = FALSE) }

code: worldclim_temp_indo <- LUMENSR_example("wc2.1_30s_bio_1_indo.tif") temp_indo <-  terra::rast(worldclim_temp_indo) harmonise_raster(dat_clim = temp_indo, batas_kab = ntt_admin) #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 197, 377, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 1833.499, 1833.499  (x, y) #> extent      : 51248.79, 742477.9, 8779377, 9140576  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : WGS 84 / UTM zone 51S (EPSG:32751)  #> source(s)   : memory #> name        : wc2.1_30s_bio_1  #> min value   :        16.81118  #> max value   :        28.24243

what: PreQUES Land Use Change Analysis Report — lookup_traj_reclass
title: PreQUES Land Use Change Analysis Report — lookup_traj_reclass
text: PreQUES_report.qmd R Markdown document generates report analyzing land use change. follows Quick Ecosystem Service Assessment (Ques) methodology used identify evaluate impact land use change various ecosystem services. quespre_by_pu.qmd knitr child document used generation land use change analysis reports. child document used perform analyses per planning unit basis, thus providing granular results. lookup table maps land cover codes respective descriptions trajectory classes. original land cover values replaced sequence numbers 1 23.

title: PreQUES Land Use Change Analysis Report — lookup_traj_reclass
PreQUES Land Use Change Analysis Report — lookup_traj_reclass
text: R Markdown (qmd) file can rendered variety formats including HTML, PDF, Word. R Markdown (qmd) child file incorporated main R Markdown file via child parameter code chunk. data frame 23 rows 4 columns: Value Reclassified land cover codes ranging 1 23 PL20 Descriptions corresponding land cover code Bahasa Indonesia traj_id Trajectory ID land cover code trajectory English descriptions corresponding trajectory ID

title: PreQUES Land Use Change Analysis Report — lookup_traj_reclass
text: analysis methodology based Quantification Environmental Services module. Analysis Per Planning Unit Child Document child document part Quantification Environmental Services module. Lookup Table Reclassified Trajectories data adapted Indonesian Ministry Environment Forestry (KLHK).

what: Lookup Table for Land Cover Change Trajectories — lookup_trajectory_complete
title: Lookup Table for Land Cover Change Trajectories — lookup_trajectory_complete
text: lookup_trajectory_complete data frame provides comprehensive lookup table land cover change trajectories. maps combinations initial final land cover classes specific trajectory IDs defines corresponding trajectory descriptions.

title: Lookup Table for Land Cover Change Trajectories — lookup_trajectory_complete
Lookup Table for Land Cover Change Trajectories — lookup_trajectory_complete
text: data frame 64 rows 7 columns: ID_1 Numeric identifier initial land cover class. ID_2 Numeric identifier final land cover class. CLASS_1 Description initial land cover class. CLASS_2 Description final land cover class. ID_traj Unique identifier land cover change trajectory, formed combining ID_1 ID_2 underscore. trajectory Detailed description land cover change trajectory. def Simplified definition category land cover change trajectory.

title: Lookup Table for Land Cover Change Trajectories — lookup_trajectory_complete
text: LUMENSR package

title: Lookup Table for Land Cover Change Trajectories — lookup_trajectory_complete
text: lookup_trajectory_complete data frame provides mapping land cover change trajectories. considers possible combinations initial final land cover classes assigns unique trajectory ID combination. data frame also includes detailed descriptions simplified definitions trajectory. land cover classes considered lookup table : Undisturbed forest Logged-forest Monoculture tree-based plantation Shrub, grass, cleared land Agriculture/annual crop Mixed tree-based plantation Others Settlement built-area ID_traj column formed concatenating ID_1 ID_2 values underscore, providing unique identifier land cover change trajectory. trajectory column provides detailed description land cover change trajectory, indicating specific transition initial land cover class final land cover class. def column provides simplified definition category land cover change trajectory, "Stable forest," "Reforestation," "Deforestation," "."

title: Lookup Table for Land Cover Change Trajectories — lookup_trajectory_complete
code: # View the first few rows of the lookup table head(lookup_trajectory_complete) #>   ID_1 ID_2                           CLASS_1            CLASS_2 ID_traj #> 1    1    1                Undisturbed forest Undisturbed forest     1_1 #> 2    2    1                Logged-over forest Undisturbed forest     2_1 #> 3    3    1 Monoculture tree-based plantation Undisturbed forest     3_1 #> 4    4    1    Shrub, grass, and cleared land Undisturbed forest     4_1 #> 5    5    1           Agriculture/annual crop Undisturbed forest     5_1 #> 6    6    1       Mixed tree-based plantation Undisturbed forest     6_1 #>              trajectory           def #> 1 Stable natural forest Stable forest #> 2    Recovery to forest Reforestation #> 3    Recovery to forest Reforestation #> 4    Recovery to forest Reforestation #> 5    Recovery to forest Reforestation #> 6    Recovery to forest Reforestation  # Filter the lookup table for a specific initial land cover class subset(lookup_trajectory_complete, ID_1 == 1) #>    ID_1 ID_2            CLASS_1                           CLASS_2 ID_traj #> 1     1    1 Undisturbed forest                Undisturbed forest     1_1 #> 9     1    2 Undisturbed forest                Logged-over forest     1_2 #> 17    1    3 Undisturbed forest Monoculture tree-based plantation     1_3 #> 25    1    4 Undisturbed forest    Shrub, grass, and cleared land     1_4 #> 33    1    5 Undisturbed forest           Agriculture/annual crop     1_5 #> 41    1    6 Undisturbed forest       Mixed tree-based plantation     1_6 #> 49    1    7 Undisturbed forest                            Others     1_7 #> 57    1    8 Undisturbed forest      Settlement and built-up area     1_8 #>                         trajectory                def #> 1            Stable natural forest      Stable forest #> 9       Loss to logged-over forest Forest degradation #> 17                           Other              Other #> 25 Loss to bare land and abandoned      Deforestation #> 33                Loss to cropland      Deforestation #> 41                           Other              Other #> 49                           Other              Other #> 57          Loss to infrastructure      Deforestation

what: Lookup Table for Land Cover Trajectories — lut_trajectory
title: Lookup Table for Land Cover Trajectories — lut_trajectory
text: lut_trajectory tibble contains lookup table maps trajectory IDs corresponding land cover trajectory descriptions. lookup table used assign meaningful labels land cover change trajectories identified analysis.

title: Lookup Table for Land Cover Trajectories — lut_trajectory
Lookup Table for Land Cover Trajectories — lut_trajectory
text: tibble 8 rows 2 columns: traj_id unique identifier land cover trajectory (integer). trajectory description land cover trajectory corresponding traj_id (character).

title: Lookup Table for Land Cover Trajectories — lut_trajectory
text: LUMENSR package

title: Lookup Table for Land Cover Trajectories — lut_trajectory
text: land cover trajectories represented lookup table : Undisturbed forest: Areas remained undisturbed forest throughout analysis period. Logged-forest: Forest areas subject logging activities. Monoculture tree-based plantation: Plantations consist single tree species, typically grown commercial purposes. Shrub, grass, cleared land: Areas covered shrubs, grasslands, land cleared previous vegetation. Agriculture/annual crop: Land used agricultural purposes, particularly growing annual crops. Mixed tree-based plantation: Plantations consist multiple tree species, often mix commercial native species. Others: Land cover types fall defined categories. Settlement built-area: Areas developed human settlement, including urban rural built-areas. lookup table typically used conjunction land cover change analysis functions LUMENSR package. helps assigning meaningful labels identified land cover trajectories, making results interpretable.

what: Historical Temperature data for East Nusa Tenggara — ntt_admin
title: Historical Temperature data for East Nusa Tenggara — ntt_admin
text: subset WorldClim version 2.1 climate data 1970-2000. version released January 2020; 30 seconds (~1 km2) spatial resolution. clipped raster dataset BIO1 = Annual Mean Temperature East Nusa Tenggara. subset WorldClim version 2.1 climate data 1970-2000. version released January 2020; 30 seconds (~1 km2) spatial resolution. clipped raster dataset BIO1 = Annual Mean Temperature Indonesia. spatial dataset containing district boundaries East Nusa Tenggara.

Historical Temperature data for East Nusa Tenggara — ntt_admin
text: RasterLayer object : dimensions number rows, columns, layers resolution x y resolution extent geographical extent crs coordinate reference system values raster values, case representing annual mean temperature RasterLayer object : dimensions number rows, columns, layers resolution x y resolution extent geographical extent crs coordinate reference system values raster values, case representing annual mean temperature SpatialPolygonsDataFrame object 22 features 2 fields: ID Country name Kabupaten District names East Nusa Tenggara

what: Plot Frequency or Area of Land Cover Change as a Bar Chart — plot_lcc_freq_bar
title: Plot Frequency or Area of Land Cover Change as a Bar Chart — plot_lcc_freq_bar
text: function takes data frame plots frequency area land cover changes bar chart. automatically detects column named "Ha" exists, , plots data using "Ha" priority "Freq". "Ha" exist, defaults back using "Freq".

title: Plot Frequency or Area of Land Cover Change as a Bar Chart — plot_lcc_freq_bar

title: Plot Frequency or Area of Land Cover Change as a Bar Chart — plot_lcc_freq_bar
text: lcc_table data frame containing least two columns characters one column numeric values. col_T1 First column characters. NULL, function assign first column containing characters. col_T2 Second column characters. NULL, function assign second column containing characters. Freq Numeric column representing frequencies areas. NULL, function assign "Ha" present, otherwise first numeric column.

title: Prints a frequency table as an HTML table using the gt package — print_frequency_table
text: df data frame convert HTML table. title title table. Default: "Top 10 Type Land Cover Change". labels named vector column labels use place original column names. Names vector match column names df. Default: NULL (original names used). freq_col name column format frequency. Default: "Freq". table_width width table pixels. Default: 700. font_size font size pixels. Default: 12.

what: Pre-QUES Land cover change analysis — ques_pre
title: Pre-QUES Land cover change analysis — ques_pre
text: function preprocesses land cover data visualization, calculation, summarization. checks consistency input data, creates visualizations input data, calculates land cover frequency, creates crosstabulation land cover changes, summarizes results landscape planning unit level. function also converts pixels hectares convert_to_Ha set TRUE.

title: Pre-QUES Land cover change analysis — ques_pre
code: ques_pre(   lc_t1,   lc_t2,   admin_,   cutoff_landscape = 5000,   cutoff_pu = 500,   convert_to_Ha = TRUE )

title: Pre-QUES Land cover change analysis — ques_pre
text: lc_t1 spatRaster object representing land cover data period T1. lc_t2 spatRaster object representing land cover data period T2. admin_ spatRaster object representing planning unit data. Can also sf multipolygon object, case rasterized. cutoff_landscape minimum number pixel/ area displayed sankey plot landscape level cutoff_pu minimum number pixel/ area displayed sankey plot planing unit level convert_to_Ha Logical flag indicating whether convert pixel count hectares based resolution lc_t1 raster.

title: Pre-QUES Land cover change analysis — ques_pre
text: list results containing input data visualizations, landscape level results, planning unit level results.

title: Pre-QUES Land cover change analysis — ques_pre
code: if (FALSE) { # Load and annotate land cover data for period T1 lc_t1_ <- LUMENSR_example("NTT_LC90.tif") %>%   terra::rast() %>%   add_legend_to_categorical_raster(     raster_file = .,     lookup_table = lc_lookup_klhk_sequence,     year = 1990)  # Load and annotate land cover data for period T2   terra::rast() %>%   add_legend_to_categorical_raster(     raster_file = .,     lookup_table = lc_lookup_klhk_sequence,    year = 2020)  # Load planning unit data admin_z <- LUMENSR_example("ntt_admin_spatraster.tif") %>%   terra::rast() ques_pre(lc_t1_, lc_t2_, admin_z) }

what: Calculate land use and land cover change trajectory — ques_pre_trajectory
title: Calculate land use and land cover change trajectory — ques_pre_trajectory
text: function calculates trajectory map, creates cross-tabulation land cover administrative zones, plots bar chart trajectory data.

title: Calculate land use and land cover change trajectory — ques_pre_trajectory
code: ques_pre_trajectory(   lc_t1_,   lc_t2_,   admin_,   lookup_traj_reclass,   lookup_trajectory_complete,   trajectory_column_name = "trajectory",   convert_to_Ha = TRUE )

title: Calculate land use and land cover change trajectory — ques_pre_trajectory
text: lc_t1_ raster layer representing land cover time 1. lc_t2_ raster layer representing land cover time 2. admin_ raster layer representing administrative zones. lookup_traj_reclass lookup table reclassifying trajectories. lookup_trajectory_complete lookup table completing trajectories. trajectory_column_name name trajectory column. Default "trajectory". convert_to_Ha Logical. TRUE, pixel counts converted hectares. Default TRUE.

title: Calculate land use and land cover change trajectory — ques_pre_trajectory
text: list containing trajectory map, area table, bar plot.

title: Calculate land use and land cover change trajectory — ques_pre_trajectory
code: if (FALSE) { ques_pre_trajectory(lc_t1_, lc_t2_, admin_, lookup_traj_reclass, lookup_trajectory_complete) }

Rasterize an sf MULTIPOLYGON object — rasterise_multipolygon

title: Rasterize an sf MULTIPOLYGON object — rasterise_multipolygon
code: rasterise_multipolygon(sf_object = ntt_admin, raster_res = c(100,100), field = "ID") #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 3570, 6884, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 100, 100  (x, y) #> extent      : 52661.8, 741061.8, 8783176, 9140176  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : WGS 84 / UTM zone 51S (EPSG:32751)  #> source(s)   : memory #> categories  : Kabupaten  #> name        :        Kabupaten  #> min value   :     Sumba Tengah  #> max value   : Sumba Barat Daya

title: Visualize Temperature Map — vis_map_temperature

title: LUMENSR 0.0.0.9000
text: Improved Pre-QUES.qmd layout introduced function converting pixel-based calculations hectares (#10). Added NEWS.md file track changes package (fixes #8).
